website_summaries.verdict: While its design may not appeal to everyone, this comfortable thumb-controlled mouse is particularly good for those who suffer from wrist cramping or carpal tunnel.
pros: Thumb-controlled trackball takes the place of the mouse moving
Uses one AA battery (included), which lasts up to 18 months
Good for working in tight spots, and doesn't need a flat surface
Works with Windows and Mac OS
cons: Trackball can stick on some of these
The thumb trackball design may take some getting used to
Not the best choice for gaming, heavy graphics, or photo editing

customer_reviews.title: Can be used anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have thumb arthritis issues, this is the easiest, most flexible mouse there is. I use this with CAD and large spreadsheet programs and can tailor the speed and accuracy to meet my preference. I can also use it anywhere since it doesn't rely on a flat optical friendly surface, e.g. any place you can put it down (top of your head, beach chair arm, chest, etc.). I've kept it in my pocket during PowerPoint presentations, just like a weatherman (woman).
customer_reviews.author: John in NC

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Logitech Trackball since 1999...back when they had a wire. These work just as well. I'll never switch back to a regular mouse. Is nice if you have artheritis. They take a day or two to get used to, but once you do, you won't switch back. They'll last you several years, and the battery life lasts well over a year. I swear by these even though my co-workers hate it. Plus they are half of the price they used to be - nice!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great product for hand comfort and ease of use.

Don't get any wireless mouse if security is at all a concern for you. Despite buying this new it has unpatched firmware vulnerabilities in which exploitation, or rootkit, can lead to full system control. Look for yourself mousejack.com Had I known prior, I would have opted for the wired version. Lowered rating because Logitech has known about this issue for a very long time and has failed to secure their wireless devices.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at work, got one for home

I can take it as my spare mouse when travelling and never have to use the silly trackpad on the laptop. MUCH easier to use. I recommend grabbing the Logitech software and fully customizing the features as you can really get it to perform to your needs.

product_meta.title: Logitech M570 Wireless Trackball Mouse
product_meta.description:
Your coffee table. Your favorite chair. Your comfy bed. Now there's no limit to Where you can get precise cursor control. This hand-friendly wireless trackball lets you work and play wherever you want. No mouse to move around. No tricky keypad leaving your hand feeling cramped. Just roll the ball with your thumb and click. Precision never felt so comfortable. Thumb-operated trackball and laser sensor for smooth, precise cursor control. Works anywhere you do—even your sofa. Powerful 30 ft. Wireless Range with tiny leave-in Logitech Unifying receiver. It has up to 18 months of power on a single AA battery. Scroll wheel and back/forward buttons for easy document and web page navigation. Enhanced comfort—refines the time-tested shape of the popular Logitech Trackman wheel.

thumb-controlled trackball stays in one place
no need to slide around a mouse or move your arm to move your cursor
sculpted shape supports your hand for comfortable control all day long
compact footprint—great for tight work spaces with limited room to use a mouse
advanced Logitech 2.4 GHz for Fast data transmission with virtually no delays or dropouts.
works with Windows, Mac OS, chromeos

logitech M570 2.4GHz wireless 5-button laser trackball mouse
logitech Unifying USB receiver
battery not included
